title: Matt Bishop: 'I discovered Monaco's magic despite the dull F1 race'
summary: There's plenty to love about Monaco — just don't expect it to serve up a thrilling F1 race saysMatt Bishopwho, in 1995, discovered an alternative — and unrepeatable — way to experience the grand prix weekend

qa_pairs.question: What is the Monaco Grand Prix known for in terms of its racing characteristics?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: It is often criticized for being less thrilling due to its narrow streets and lack of overtaking opportunities.
wrong_options: It always provides dramatic crashes and high-speed action.
It is known for its high-speed straights and overtaking zones.
It has the most car retirements of any race on the calendar.

qa_pairs.question: In what year did Matt Bishop first experience the Monaco Grand Prix?
What aspect of the Monaco Grand Prix does Matt Bishop suggest can be appreciated despite the race's lack of excitement?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: The unique atmosphere and charm of the event.
wrong_options: The technological advancements in car design.
